[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/transaction-filter/src/filters/event.rs] [Input Validation: Substring Content] The data_substring_filter is validated via is_valid() but not for content. Can substring patterns with regex metacharacters, control characters, or binary data cause unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/transaction-filter/src/filters/move_module.rs] [Input Validation: Module Naming] Module and name fields are not validated for Move naming rules. Can invalid identifiers (starting with numbers, containing spaces, etc.) bypass validation but cause errors later? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/transaction-filter/src/boolean_transaction_filter.rs] [Input Validation: Recursive Depth] While size is checked, recursion depth is not. Can an attacker create filters with extreme nesting depth that pass size checks but cause stack overflow? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/transaction-filter/src/filters/transaction_root.rs] [Error Handling: Panic] Line 69 uses .expect() which will panic on invalid transaction type. Should this return an error instead to prevent indexer crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/transaction-filter/src/boolean_transaction_filter.rs] [Error Handling: Proto Conversion] The try_into() calls for proto conversion can fail. Are all error paths properly handled, or can some failures cause silent corruption or partial state? (High)
